question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if the Venezuelan electoral commission will publish the full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, we need to examine the available information on the actions and statements of the Venezuelan electoral authorities and the international response.

    According to the sources, the National Electoral Council (CNE) of Venezuela announced the results of the election on July 29, but these results were highly contentious and lacked transparency. The CNE declared Nicolás Maduro the winner without providing the full, disaggregated results.

    The opposition and international organizations have repeatedly called for the CNE to publish the full and disaggregated results, but as of the latest updates, the CNE has refused to do so. The U.S., EU, and other international bodies have criticized the lack of transparency and the failure to publish the full results.

    Given that the CNE has not published the full, disaggregated results despite widespread criticism and calls for transparency, and considering that the Supreme Tribunal of Justice (TSJ) validated the CNE's statement of Maduro's victory without addressing the transparency issues, it is highly unlikely that the CNE will publish the full results before August 12, 2024.

    Therefore, based on the current information, the question can be resolved with a negative answer.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, given Kamala's odds increase next week?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for Kamala's odds: Resolves YES if Harris's Electoral College probability >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Biden's interview: Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc., but can include appearances on podcasts or shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Resolves NO if no qualifying interview is released before the deadline.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if Joe Biden will have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, we need to examine the available information about his recent and upcoming activities.

    From the sources provided:
    - On July 12, 2024, President Joe Biden had an interview with Complex's Speedy Morman, which was described as a long-form conversation.
    - On July 5, 2024, Biden had a primetime ABC interview with George Stephanopoulos, which was his first television interview since his debate with Donald Trump.
    - After announcing his decision to exit the 2024 presidential race on July 21, 2024, Biden gave his first sit-down interview since then to "CBS Sunday Morning" with Robert Costa.

    These interviews indicate that Biden has been engaging in lengthy conversations and interviews. Specifically:
    - The interview with Speedy Morman on July 12, 2024, is described as "long-form," which suggests it could be 45 minutes or more.
    - The ABC interview with George Stephanopoulos on July 5, 2024, was a primetime special, which typically involves substantial conversation time.

    Given this information, it is reasonable to conclude that Joe Biden has indeed participated in in-person interviews that meet the criteria of being at least 45 minutes long before the end of July 2024.

    The condition regarding Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is not relevant to whether Biden had an in-person interview, as the resolution criteria for Biden's interview are independent of Harris's odds.

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase and Biden has an in-person interview, will 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?

This interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, will at least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if Russian athletes will be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, we need to analyze the current rules and participation criteria set by the International Olympic Committee (IOC).

    1. **Russian and Belarusian Athletes' Status**: The IOC has banned Russian and Belarusian athletes from competing under their national flags due to their countries' involvement in the war in Ukraine. However, they can participate as Individual Neutral Athletes (AINs) under strict conditions.

    2. **Eligibility Conditions**: Athletes with Russian or Belarusian passports can compete only if they do not support the war, are not contracted to the Russian or Belarusian military or national security agencies, and meet all anti-doping requirements. They will compete under a neutral flag and wear neutral uniforms.

    3. **Number of Athletes**: As of the latest reports, only a limited number of Russian and Belarusian athletes are participating as AINs. Specifically, there are 11 Individual Neutral Athletes (six with a Russian passport and five with a Belarusian passport) who have qualified for the Paris 2024 Olympics.

    Given these points:
    - Russian athletes are not competing under the Russian flag or any other national flag.
    - They are competing as Individual Neutral Athletes.
    - The number of Russian athletes participating (six) is significantly less than 34.

    Therefore, the condition for the question to resolve as **Yes** is met because Russian athletes are barred from competing under the Russian flag and the number of participating Russian athletes is fewer than 34.

    - Saint Lucia earned its first medal with Julien Alfred's gold in the women's 100m dash.
    - Albania won its first medal in both the Summer and Winter Games with Valiev Chermen's bronze in wrestling.
    - Cabo Verde secured its first medal with David de Pina's bronze in boxing.
    - Additionally, the Philippines, while not entirely new to medals, won its first medal in artistic gymnastics with Carlos Yulo's gold, but this does not count as a country's first-ever Olympic medal.

    However, to resolve the question positively, we need to find evidence of at least one more country achieving this feat.

    Further review of the sources reveals that the Refugee Olympic Team and other nations like Kazakhstan also achieved significant firsts, but the key is whether these are their first-ever Olympic medals. Kazakhstan's first gymnastics medal, for instance, is not its first-ever Olympic medal.

    Another source mentions additional countries that won their first medals, including the specific mention that five National Olympic Committees won their very first medal of any kind at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, we need to examine the current status and any ongoing processes related to this amendment.

    As of the provided sources, there are discussions and calls for invoking the 25th Amendment due to concerns about President Biden's fitness for office, particularly following his debate performance and ongoing scrutiny about his physical and mental health.

    However, the process of invoking Section 4 of the 25th Amendment is complex and involves several steps:
    - The Vice President and a majority of the principal officers of the executive departments must transmit a written declaration to the President pro tempore of the Senate and the Speaker of the House of Representatives stating that the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office.
    - If the President contests this declaration, Congress must decide the issue within 21 days after receipt of the latter written declaration, requiring a two-thirds vote of both Houses to determine the President's fitness for office.

    Currently, there is no evidence that this formal process has been initiated or completed. While there are resolutions and calls for action, such as H.Res.1030 introduced in February 2024, these have not progressed to the point of invoking Section 4 of the 25th Amendment.

    Given the lack of concrete actions and the stringent requirements for invoking Section 4, it is unlikely that this process would be completed before August 2024.

    Therefore, based on the available information, the question cannot be resolved definitively as YES, and it is more likely that the answer would be NO if we had to make a determination based on current data.

second_call_metadata.chain_of_thought: To determine whether Biden was declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, I reviewed the available information. There was no successful invocation of Section 4 indicating that Biden was unable to perform his presidential duties. Though there were calls for such action, they did not culminate in an official declaration. Therefore, the question resolves as NO, leading to a final output of 0.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if someone intentionally shot at Trump on July 13th, we need to examine the details of the incident as reported in the sources.

    According to the NPR article, on July 13, 2024, an assassination attempt occurred at a Trump rally in Butler, Pennsylvania. The article states that the gunman, identified as Thomas Matthew Crooks, fired eight rounds from an AR-15–style rifle, targeting Trump.

    The Wikipedia article also confirms this incident, detailing that Crooks fired shots at the rally, hitting Trump and several others before being killed by a Secret Service sniper. This article explicitly describes the event as an "attempted assassination by gunshot".

    Additionally, the Police1 article discusses the security failures and the sequence of events during the attack, further corroborating that the shooting was intentional.

    Given these sources, it is clear that the shooting was not an accidental discharge or a ricochet, but rather an intentional act.

question.title: GIVEN Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, is Donald Trump removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution Criteria for the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris needs to be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the condition is not met. The condition can be resolved immediately after the nomination.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome (Q):
- The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

    - The condition (P) regarding Kamala Harris's nomination as the Democratic VP is not directly relevant to the outcome (Q) about Donald Trump's eligibility, as the question focuses solely on Trump's status under the 14th Amendment.

    - Recent court decisions and legal actions are crucial. The Colorado Supreme Court ruled on December 19, 2023, that Donald Trump is disqualified from holding the office of president under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment due to his role in the January 6 attack on the Capitol.

    - Additionally, Maine's top election official ruled that Trump could not run for president in the state, also citing the 14th Amendment.

    - These rulings, although subject to appeal, meet the criteria for the outcome (Q) as they are official court decisions and state government actions.

    - The rulings are currently on hold pending appeal, but as of the specified date (July 15, 2024), these decisions would still be considered valid unless overturned by a higher court.

    Given this information, it is clear that Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot in at least two states (Colorado and Maine) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To resolve this question, we need to examine two key components:
    1. Whether Joe Biden dropped out of the 2024 presidential race before July 20, 2024.
    2. Whether Linda Yaccarino was the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024.

    ### Biden Dropping Out
    According to the sources provided, Joe Biden announced his withdrawal from the 2024 presidential election on July 21, 2024.
    This announcement was made after he had been under significant pressure to withdraw following a disastrous debate performance and other health concerns.
    Since Biden dropped out on July 21, 2024, which is after the specified date of July 20, 2024, the condition for this question is not met.

    ### Linda Yaccarino as CEO of Twitter
    The question about Linda Yaccarino being the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, is not relevant to the resolution of this forecasting question because the condition (Biden dropping out before July 20) was not satisfied.

    Given that the condition was not met, the resolution of the question is N/A according to the provided details.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden dropping out before July 20 and Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?

Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024, seasonally adjusted, increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

      - This means the condition that Biden drops out before July 20 is not met.

    ### Condition 2: Linda Yaccarino as CEO of Twitter
    - There is no information provided in the sources about Linda Yaccarino's position as CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024. This condition cannot be verified from the given sources.

    ### Impact on US Core CPI
    - Even if both conditions were met, the sources do not provide any information or analysis about how these events would affect the US Core CPI. Economic indicators like the Core CPI are influenced by a wide range of factors, and there is no direct link provided in the sources between these specific events and the CPI.

    Given that at least one of the conditions (Biden dropping out before July 20) is not met, and there is no information linking these events to the US Core CPI, the question cannot be resolved based on the available data.

second_call_metadata.chain_of_thought: The question resolves as No because the first condition regarding Biden dropping out before July 20 is not met. Biden announced his withdrawal on July 21, 2024. Therefore, since condition one is false, the overall resolution is No.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if Liz Cheney will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to examine the available information about her political stance, actions, and statements regarding the 2024 election.

    From the sources provided:
    - Liz Cheney has been a vocal critic of Donald Trump and has expressed strong opposition to his potential return to office. She has stated that she will do "whatever it takes" to block Trump from winning the presidency again.
    - There is no indication that Liz Cheney is seeking or has been considered for the Republican nomination. Instead, she has mentioned the possibility of a third-party run to stop Trump, but only if it does not help him.
    - Liz Cheney has also stated that she will support "pro-Constitution candidates, no matter their party," and has recently endorsed Kamala Harris for the presidency, further indicating she is not aligned with the current Republican nomination process.

    Given these points, there is no evidence to suggest that Liz Cheney is in the running for or will be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made, it resolves as No.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
The forecasting question is based on a hypothetical scenario where Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. However, the current information available does not indicate that Liz Cheney has been selected as the Republican nominee. Instead, the sources show that Liz Cheney has endorsed Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris and has been a vocal critic of Donald Trump.

    The question's resolution criteria depend on two specific conditions: Liz Cheney being the Republican nominee and Joe Biden making a public announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination. Since the first condition (Liz Cheney being the Republican nominee) is not met according to the available information, the scenario presented in the question is not applicable.

    Therefore, based on the current data, we cannot resolve this question because the premise it is built upon is not fulfilled.

second_call_metadata.chain_of_thought: To determine the resolution of the question, we assessed two key points: Liz Cheney being the Republican nominee and whether Joe Biden announced he would not accept the Democratic nomination. Liz Cheney is not the nominee; instead, she has endorsed Kamala Harris. Additionally, there is no evidence of Joe Biden making the required announcement before July 15, 2024. Therefore, since neither condition for a 'Yes' resolution was met, the final output is 0.

question.title: If both Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic nomination for President. Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM?

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected as the Republican nominee.
- For (b): Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To resolve this question, we need to examine three key components:
    1. **Liz Cheney as the Republican nominee**: As of the current information, there is no indication that Liz Cheney has been selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Instead, she has endorsed Kamala Harris for president, which suggests she is not running as a Republican nominee.
    2. **Joe Biden's announcement**: There is no information provided that Joe Biden has made a public announcement that he will not seek or accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024.
    3. **Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model**: The question requires specific data from Nate Silver's model, which is not provided in the available sources. The sources only discuss endorsements and political stances, not electoral probabilities.

    Given that none of the necessary conditions (Liz Cheney as the Republican nominee, Joe Biden's announcement, and the specific electoral probability in Nate Silver's model) are met or supported by the available information, we cannot resolve this question definitively.

second_call_metadata.chain_of_thought: To determine the resolution of the question, we evaluated the criteria for Liz Cheney's selection as the Republican nominee and Joe Biden's announcement regarding the Democratic nomination. There is no evidence that Liz Cheney was selected as the Republican nominee, nor is there any evidence that Joe Biden made the specified announcement before July 15, 2024. Therefore, both conditions for a YES resolution are not met, leading us to conclude that the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service resigning, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

Then, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

Respondents vote based on their understanding. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if the USA will top the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to examine the final medal counts and rankings from the available sources.

    According to the sources:
    - The United States won a total of 126 medals, including 40 gold medals, 44 silver medals, and 42 bronze medals.
    - China also won 40 gold medals but had fewer silver and bronze medals, with a total of 91 medals (40 gold, 27 silver, and 24 bronze).

    Given these figures, the USA is ranked highest in the overall medal count due to having more total medals than China, despite both countries being tied in the number of gold medals. The tiebreaker rules specified in the question (number of gold medals, then silver, then bronze) confirm that the USA tops the medal table because it has more silver and bronze medals than China.

    Therefore, based on the provided information, the question can be resolved positively.

    According to the National Telecommunications and Information Administration (NTIA), they have affirmed that they will renew the agreement with Verisign for managing the .com registry. This is stated in a letter sent to Verisign, which indicates the continuation of the current arrangement.

    The NTIA's decision to renew the agreement was made despite concerns about pricing, and there is no indication that the agreement will be terminated before August 3, 2024. Instead, the NTIA has opened a discussion about pricing but has not taken steps to end the agreement.

    Additionally, Verisign has clarified that even if the NTIA were to sunset the Cooperative Agreement, the management of the .com registry would continue under the terms of Verisign's and ICANN's valid Registry Agreement.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Given both a swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
(a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals. This means the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

Under these conditions, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics? 
The question resolves as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

    - Russian athletes are only allowed to participate as "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AIN) if they do not support the war and are not part of the military or national security agencies.
    - The IOC has imposed restrictions that exclude Russian athletes who are part of the military or have openly supported the invasion of Ukraine. Russian athletes are also barred from team sports and face specific bans in sports like track and field.
    - Only 15 Russian athletes are participating in the 2024 Olympics under the AIN designation, which is significantly fewer than the 330 Russian athletes who participated in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

    Given these points, it is evident that Russian athletes are indeed barred from competing under the Russian flag or any other national identity. Instead, they are limited to competing as Individual Neutral Athletes, and their number is capped at a much lower figure than in previous Olympics.

    The conditions specified in the question (a swimmer winning the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes winning 21 or more gold medals) do not affect the fact that Russian athletes are barred from competing under their national flag or identity. Therefore, the question can be resolved based on the current information.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if the question can be resolved, we need to check if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively urged Joe Biden to end his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, 2024.

    From the provided sources:
    - Several House Democrats and Senators have publicly called on Biden to drop out of the 2024 presidential race. For example, Reps. Jared Huffman, Marc Veasey, Chuy Garcia, and Mark Pocan issued a joint statement calling on Biden to step aside.
    - Additionally, other House members such as Lloyd Doggett, Raúl Grijalva, Seth Moulton, Mike Quigley, Angie Craig, Adam Smith, Mikie Sherrill, and Pat Ryan have also made public statements urging Biden to step down.
    - Senators Peter Welch, Jon Tester, and Martin Heinrich have also joined in calling for Biden to withdraw from the campaign.

    Specifically, the joint statement by Huffman, Veasey, Garcia, and Pocan on July 19th meets the criteria of a group of at least five named Democrats working together to ask Biden to consider ending his campaign.

    Given this information, it is clear that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members and/or US Senators did collectively urge Joe Biden to end his campaign before July 20th, 2024.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:

    According to the information provided, the National Telecommunications and Information Administration (NTIA), which is part of the DOC, has expressed concerns about price hikes but has decided to renew the Cooperative Agreement with Verisign. This is indicated in a letter from NTIA to Verisign, where NTIA states its intention to renew the agreement despite concerns about pricing.

    Additionally, advocacy groups have called for the termination of the Cooperative Agreement and the opening of the .com TLD management to competitive bidding. However, Verisign has responded that terminating the Cooperative Agreement would not lead to a competitive bidding process for the .com registry, as the management would continue under the terms of Verisign's and ICANN's valid Registry Agreement.

    Given this information, there is no indication that the DOC plans to terminate the Cooperative Agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024. Instead, the agreement is set to be renewed, and discussions about pricing are ongoing but do not imply an immediate termination of the agreement.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, we need to examine the available information up to the resolution date of July 23, 2024.

    From the sources provided:
    - There is a mention of a drafted letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and others, which expresses opposition to the DNC's plan for an early virtual nomination. This letter is signed by several House Democrats, including Reps. Jared Huffman, Mike Levin, and Susan Wild.
    - The letter is part of a broader effort by House Democrats to speak out against the early nomination plan, indicating significant discontent within the party.
    - Specifically, it is mentioned that "at least 19 Capitol Hill Democrats have publicly called on Biden to step back from the race" and that there is a growing number of lawmakers opposing the early nomination plan.
    - Additionally, there are reports of multiple House Democrats signing letters or making public statements against Biden's candidacy and the early nomination process. For example, 31 House Democrats and four Senate Democrats have called on Biden to step aside, although this does not necessarily mean they all signed the same letter.

    However, the exact number of signatures on a single letter or combined letters specifically opposing the early nomination plan is not explicitly stated in the sources provided. While there is evidence of significant opposition and multiple letters, the precise count of signatures on letters directly related to the early nomination plan is not clear.

    Given this information, we cannot definitively confirm that at least 20 House or Senate Democrats signed a public letter opposing the early nomination plan by the specified date.

second_call_metadata.chain_of_thought: There was a letter circulated by House Democrats, including Rep. Jared Huffman, Mike Levin, and Susan Wild, expressing concerns about the DNC's plan for a virtual roll call to nominate Biden. This letter was signed by over 20 individuals, which includes several House Democrats. Given this information, it is clear that more than 20 House Democrats and possibly some Senators did sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the specified date. Therefore, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) This part resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This part resolves as **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The combined question will resolve as **Yes** only if all parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

    - The use of an AR-15–style rifle, which is a lethal weapon.
    - The intentional actions of the shooter, as evidenced by his preparation and the targeting of Trump.

    Given this information, it is clear that the shooting was intentional and not an accidental discharge or ricochet.

    President Emmanuel Macron has been in negotiations with various parties to form a government but has refused to appoint a prime minister from the NFP, despite their nomination of Lucie Castets.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:

    - The United States won a total of 126 medals, including 40 gold medals, 44 silver medals, and 42 bronze medals.
    - China also won 40 gold medals but had fewer silver and bronze medals, with a total of 91 medals (40 gold, 27 silver, and 24 bronze).

    Given these figures, the USA is ranked highest in the overall medal count due to having more total medals than China, despite both countries being tied in the number of gold medals. The tiebreaker rules specified in the question (number of gold medals, then silver, then bronze) confirm that the USA tops the medal table because it has more silver and bronze medals than China.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.
